author: 0x1984
content: ETH had a long exit queue(20 days) after Shanghai withdraw activation, now it has a long staking queue(40 days). The excessive fluctuations only hurt small stakers and drive them into large LSDs such as LIDO who can simply smooth out yield within their pool. No one wants to see LIDO grow bigger except LIDO itself. I see the need for ETH to increase queue capacity otherwise driving small users into LSDs

author: sky.cactus
content: I believe the exit queue is intentionally long to maximize punishment and give time for social slashing in the case of mass exits (such as when there is an attack against the network).

author: 0x1984
content: Exit queue was setup to be conservative which is understandable. However, after months smooth running, it can be adjusted to deal with LSD concentration issue. On the other hand, the staking queue does not need to be that long or slow

author: ajsutton
content:
Both entry and exit are rate limited to reduce the rate that the validator set can change and ensure the weak subjectivity period isn’t too short. 
There’s also a notable lack of any evidence for your claim that they’re increasing centralisation.

author: 0x1984
content: EF  can do a study to figure out - LSD centralization probably is #1 concern now. Also speaking to evidence, there is ZERO evidence that prolonged staking queue increases security too

author: ajsutton
content: You should start by reading up on the existing material around weak subjectivity period. I think you’ll find there’s a very comprehensive justification for the need to have rate limits on entry and exit.
